content:
As an AI language model, I don't have access to current events and research projects of the University of Rochester philosophy department, but I can provide some general examples of types of research and events that the philosophy department at the University of Rochester typically engages in:

1. Speaker series: The philosophy department regularly invites prominent scholars in various fields of philosophy to come and give talks on their research. These talks are usually open to the public and provide a great way to learn about cutting-edge research in the field.

2. Conferences: The department frequently hosts conferences on philosophy-related themes or topics. These conferences bring together scholars from around the world to share their research and ideas.

3. Collaborative work: Some faculty members work collaboratively with other scholars in various fields, including computer science, linguistics, and psychology. The department encourages interdisciplinary collaborations to explore philosophical issues.

4. Undergraduate research: The philosophy department at Rochester provides opportunities for undergraduate students to engage in research projects under the supervision of faculty members. These projects often lead to publication credits or presentations at academic conferences.

5. Ethics Bowl: Rochester hosts an annual Ethics Bowl in which teams of undergraduate students from different colleges debate ethical issues. The competition provides students with an opportunity to develop their critical thinking, communication, and argumentation skills.

These are just a few examples of the types of research and events that are happening or could happen in the philosophy department at the University of Rochester. For more information, you can contact the philosophy department directly or check their website.
